channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL

item.title: Report E-2024010350
item.description:
Report E-2024010350

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 12, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing gasoline was damaged by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed that the product had already evaporated. FCE personnel placed down absorbent pads to collect any spilled product and placed the damaged drum into an 85-gallon over-pack. The over-pack was set aside for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120613
item.description:
Report X-2023120613

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 3
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box arrived in STPT damaged. Box was wet and chemicals protruding out. Fed Ex employees did not realize package was damaged and while unloading package from truck the chemical spilled on to 3 people causing injury. The box with leaking liquid and was placed in a hazmat cart wrapped in hazmat bag and processed into a hazmat drum to be held for disposition. DescribePack: The entire box was wet from chemicals that spilled in box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box with leaking liquid was placed in a hazmat cart wrapped in hazmat bag and processed into a hazmat drum to be held for disposition.
